content.description: Start low on a protruding block and do some easy moves before going big to some slopers. Smaller crimps and pockets take you to the dropoff jug. The problem moves diagonally and there is a large rock beneath the upper half of the problem so attentive spotting and/or 2+ pads is advised.
content.location: Take the shortcut to Sucka Left and you will see a tiered overhang right when you hit the cliffline behind the King Boulder.

content.description: Start on a shelf at the back of the cave and work your way out the roof. Pop out the lip and drop off a jug.
content.location: Located in Sucka Left. Split off the main trail past the King Boulder and follow the cliffline another hundred feet or so.

content.description: Boulder problems are dispersed along the cliffline and usually contain some roof or face climbing to a drop jug.
